snippet: Terence Davies has a new film, “The Deep Blue Sea,” an adaptation of a Terence Rattigan play about a woman who leaves her comfortable life to follow a passion.
abstract: Terence Davies new film, The Deep Blue Sea, an adaptation of a Terence Rattigan play about a woman who leaves her comfortable life to follow a passion, bears the unmistakable stamp of the director, a noted chronicler of repressive post-war Britain; Davies says that while the film focuses on common themes, the emotional landscape of the story was uncharted.
lead_paragraph: Terence Davies has a new film, “The Deep Blue Sea,” an adaptation of a Terence Rattigan play about a woman who leaves her comfortable life to follow a passion.

headline.seo: Rachel Weisz in Terence Davies’s Film ‘The Deep Blue Sea’
headline.main: An Outsider to Blind Passion Surveys Its Wrath
headline.print_headline: An Outsider To Blind Passion Surveys Its Wrath
